metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7376 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in libxml2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging an incorrect limit for port values when handling redirects.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Debian's triage said the fix isn't complete

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3').
